properties.areaDesc: Latimer, OK; Haskell, OK; Muskogee, OK; Pittsburg, OK; McIntosh, OK; Sequoyah, OK; Le Flore, OK
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 10 at 3:21PM CST until January 10 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa OK
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Haskell County in southeastern Oklahoma...
East central McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Western Sequoyah County in east central Oklahoma...
Latimer County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Northwestern Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma...
East central Pittsburg County in southeastern Oklahoma...
Southeastern Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma...

* Until 400 PM CST.

* At 321 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from near Warner to 3 miles northeast of Higgins, moving
east at 45 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage
to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations in or near the path include...
Sallisaw...                       Wilburton...
Stigler...                        Warner...
Vian...                           Quinton...
Gore...                           Porum...
Webbers Falls...                  Keota...
Red Oak...                        Mccurtain...
Fanshawe...                       Whitefield...
Kinta...                          Marble City...
Tamaha...                         Mc Curtain...
Lequire...                        Damon...

This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 270 and
304.
properties.instruction:
Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly
from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the
basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
